Dispute_Type: Employment dispute involving termination and reinstatement
Legal_Issue: Whether the adjudicator had jurisdiction to hear the complaint under the Canada Labour Code
Evidence_Assessment: Insufficient evidence presented by employer to classify employee as a manager
Decision_Outcome: Adjudicator's decision upheld; complaint was within jurisdiction
Burden_of_Proof: On the employer to prove the employee was a manager
Legal_Rule: Section 167(3) of the Canada Labour Code excludes managers from protection under Division XIV
Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness or correctness, as applicable to jurisdictional questions
Procedural_Issue: Employer raised jurisdiction for the first time on judicial review; new evidence not admitted due to procedural flaws
Grounds_for_Claim: Unjust dismissal under the Canada Labour Code
Outcome_on_Merits: Complaint allowed; employee reinstated with monetary relief
Decision_Maker: Adjudicator under the Canada Labour Code
Review_Standard: Jurisdictional issues subject to correctness standard
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Failure to raise issue before adjudicator affected fairness and admissibility
Key_Evidence_Considered: Nature of employeeâ€™s duties, authority over hiring/firing, reporting structure
Legal_Framework: Administrative law and employment law under federal jurisdiction
Applicant_Challenge: Employer challenged adjudicator's jurisdiction based on managerial status
Court_Result: Federal Court dismissed the application for judicial review
Legal_Rule_Source: Canada Labour Code, Part III, Division XIV
Defendant_Response: Employee classified as a manager; thus outside adjudicator's jurisdiction
Evidence_Type: Documentary evidence, employment records, organizational structure
Decision_Authority: Adjudicator appointed under the Canada Labour Code
Remedy_Sought: Judicial review to overturn adjudicator's decision
Resolution_Mechanism: Administrative adjudication followed by Federal Court judicial review
Claimant_Status: Non-managerial employee protected under Division XIV
Legal_Provision_Cited: Section 167(3) of the Canada Labour Code
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Allegation that employee was a manager, thus excluded from protection
Applicable_Process: Unjust dismissal complaint process under federal labour law
Jurisdiction: Federal jurisdiction under the Canada Labour Code
Governing_Rule: Employees classified as 'managers' are excluded from unjust dismissal protections
